title: WHATWG XMLHttpRequest Workstream-relevant MDN issues
description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by WHATWG XMLHttpRequest Workstream

items.content_html:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ProgressEvent/loaded

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

ProgressEvent: loaded property

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The ratio can be calculated by dividing ProgressEvent.total by the value of this property.

What did you expect to see?

The ratio can be calculated by dividing the value of this property by ProgressEvent.total.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

I added the following listener to my file reader code and saw the the ratio is correctly calculated and ends at 100:

reader.addEventListener('progress', (e) => {
           if (!e.lengthComputable) {
                return;
           }
           console.log('progress:', e.loaded / e.total * 100);
}

Do you have anything more you want to share?

Issue is duplicated on https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileReader/progress_event

In the "Event Properties" section

MDN metadata

Page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/api/progressevent/loaded
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ProgressEvent/loaded
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/api/progressevent/loaded/index.md
  • Last commit: 6b8c7b7
  • Document last modified: 2024-10-08T19:32:59.000Z
items.title: [FileAPI, xhr] ProgressEvent.loaded documentation incorrectly describes progress ratio

items.content_html:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/XMLHttpRequest/abort

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

No response

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

"The XMLHttpRequest.abort() method aborts the request if it has already been sent. When a request is aborted, its readyState is changed to XMLHttpRequest.UNSENT (0) and the request's status code is set to 0."

What did you expect to see?

Compare to the spec, it's clear that this doesn't cover the second case:

If this’s state is opened with this’s send() flag set, headers received, or loading, then run the request error steps for this and abort.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

No response

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response
items.title: [xhr] xhr.abort is inaccurate
